newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan 4th-qtr GDP up 6.62 pct, 1996 up 5.71 pct.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan 4th-qtr GDP up 6.62 pct, 1996 up 5.71 pct.

text.p: Taiwan's gross domestic product grew a year-on-year 6.62 percent in the fourth quarter, bringing full-year 1996 economic growth to a below-target 5.71 percent, the government's statistics agency said on Thursday.
The GDP growth in the fourth quarter was higher than the forecast yielded by a recent Reuter poll among economists. The Reuter poll produced an average of 6.19 percent.
The cabinet's statistics bureau attributed the higher-than-expected GDP growth in the fourth quarter to the active stock market and an increase in the number of Taiwanese travelling abroad.
A recovery in private investments on the island in the fourth quarter also helped the growth, the bureau said.
